trans-unit.source: How to setup VPN connections in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to setup VPN connections in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to setup a VPN connection in Azure API Management and access web services through it.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to setup a VPN connection in Azure API Management and access web services through it.

trans-unit.source: How to setup VPN connections in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to setup VPN connections in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: API Management's VPN support allows you to connect your API Management proxy to an Azure Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: API Management's VPN support allows you to connect your API Management proxy to an Azure Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: This allows API Management customers to securely connect to their backend web services that are on-premises or are otherwise inaccessible to the public internet.
trans-unit.target: This allows API Management customers to securely connect to their backend web services that are on-premises or are otherwise inaccessible to the public internet.

trans-unit.source: Enable VPN connections
trans-unit.target: Enable VPN connections

trans-unit.source: VPN connectivity is only available in the **Premium** tier.
trans-unit.target: VPN connectivity is only available in the **Premium** tier.

trans-unit.source: To switch to it, open your API Management service in the [Management Portal][] and then open the **Scale** tab.
trans-unit.target: To switch to it, open your API Management service in the [Management Portal][] and then open the **Scale** tab.

trans-unit.source: Under the **General** section select the Premium tier and click Save.
trans-unit.target: Under the **General** section select the Premium tier and click Save.

trans-unit.source: To enable VPN connectivity, open your API Management service in the [Management Portal][] and switch to the **Configure** tab.
trans-unit.target: To enable VPN connectivity, open your API Management service in the [Management Portal][] and switch to the **Configure** tab.

trans-unit.source: Under the VPN section, switch **VPN connection** to **On**.
trans-unit.target: Under the VPN section, switch **VPN connection** to **On**.

trans-unit.source: Configure tab of API Management instance
trans-unit.target: Configure tab of API Management instance

trans-unit.source: You will now see a list of all regions where your API Management service is provisioned.
trans-unit.target: You will now see a list of all regions where your API Management service is provisioned.

trans-unit.source: Select a VPN and subnet for every region.
trans-unit.target: Select a VPN and subnet for every region.

trans-unit.source: The list of VPNs is populated based on the virtual networks available in your Azure subscription that are setup in the region you are configuring.
trans-unit.target: The list of VPNs is populated based on the virtual networks available in your Azure subscription that are setup in the region you are configuring.

trans-unit.source: Select VPN
trans-unit.target: Select VPN

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: You will not be able to perform other operations on the API Management service from the Azure management portal while it is updating.
trans-unit.target: You will not be able to perform other operations on the API Management service from the Azure management portal while it is updating.

trans-unit.source: The service proxy will remain available and runtime calls should not be affected.
trans-unit.target: The service proxy will remain available and runtime calls should not be affected.

trans-unit.source: Note that the VIP address of the proxy will change each time VPN is enabled or disabled.
trans-unit.target: Note that the VIP address of the proxy will change each time VPN is enabled or disabled.

trans-unit.source: Connect to a web service behind VPN
trans-unit.target: Connect to a web service behind VPN

trans-unit.source: After your API Management service is connected to the VPN, accessing web services within the virtual network is no different than accessing public services.
trans-unit.target: After your API Management service is connected to the VPN, accessing web services within the virtual network is no different than accessing public services.

trans-unit.source: Just type in the local address or the host name (if a DNS server was configured for the Azure Virtual Network) of your web service into the **Web service URL** field when creating a new API or editing an existing one.
trans-unit.target: Just type in the local address or the host name (if a DNS server was configured for the Azure Virtual Network) of your web service into the **Web service URL** field when creating a new API or editing an existing one.

trans-unit.source: Add API from VPN
trans-unit.target: Add API from VPN
